title: About
abstract: Hi, I am Guangyu Du. Nice to meet you.
story: I am a second-year graduate student at Harvard Graduate School of Design, pursuing my Master in Design Studies (MDes) Degree concentrated in Technology. Beyond architectural design, I also explore creative coding for spatial and temporal experience though computational and interactive multimedia(Efface, Loneliness: A Social Story, TA for GSD6338 Intro to Computational Design). My interest lies in the hybrid of physical and virtual world (Xenolith, Agora, Journey, Sense) that helps forge long-lasting social connections. I believe the experiences that make humans human, such as consolidating memories, awakening emotions and building relationships… will see new opportunities in the responsive and immersive environments brought by emerging technologies, through collaborative interactions with augmented physical world and shared explorations in imagined virtual world.
process: I earned my Bachelor of Architecture (B.Arch) in Tsinghua University, the School of Architecture, where I practiced in parametric architectural design(Evolving Decay, CaveArch). I intend to give attention to individuals and alleviate the loneliness in contemporary urban conditions using design and computation. I identified the loneliness inherent in several urban issues ( Obscure Loneliness), personate buildings as human beings, to understand and develop coherent urban contexts, connecting the built environment and our society.
result: I hope to build a shared mixed reality world that enables individuals to be felt, touched, and connected. I am working on an interface that visualize individual’s emotions, memories and stories on this planet. To be continued…

SORROW MAP: An Urban Memory Collector
When you feel sad, you probably want someone to share their similar experiences with you. The tendency to withdraw and isolate is dangerous. Instead, stay connected and talk with others will greatly help you battle depression. “Sorrow Map” will be a mobile app for collecting stories and memories with location-based data. Users can define their meaningful spaces in a global shared map using names, photos and music. Stories can be attached to these places only if the user is currently in this location or he/she has been there before. Different from traditional social networking, “Sorrow Map” requires physical presence before responding to and browsing through others’ stories, encouraging users to get involved in their immediate environment. Through text analyzing, “Sorrow Map” will be responsive to user’s feelings with changes of the local elements, which can also be detected by other users nearby. 2ND HOME: Space for Relational Connectedness
Whether by choice or circumstances, people who live alone or living with roommates are now more common than the nuclear family and multigenerational family. What will your life be, after work, when others go back home and have dinners with their family? In addition to learning new things, playing with a pet, watching k-drama and spending time on social media, sharing feelings with others in person is extremely important for mental health. In a world full of commercial spaces, which are designed for families and friends, it's not easy for individuals to start new relationships since the only human interaction is checking out. “2nd Home” aims to create a series of home-like spaces that encourage participation in others’ life. It restores the lost community in cities. Preparing a healthy and inexpensive dinner together, doing volunteer work, sharing thoughts on current affairs or books, talking about matters in work and life, etc. An izakaya with frequent visitors, not only for eating or drinking, but also for helping others with their life. It is possible that “Sorrow Map” can be the portal to “2nd Home”.
